messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to Civil Service Rules (Merit Pay)
- Summary: The Director of Personnel, Amy B. Trepagnier, submitted an Amendment to the Civil Service Rules (Merit Pay) to the Council for approval. The amendment aims to promote a high-performing workforce by providing annual merit-based payments to classified employees who exceed expectations. It involves budgeting two percent of combined base rates of pay for permanent classified positions and outlines eligibility criteria for merit-based pay increases.
- Ordinance Number: C4173
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (9 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The amendment was passed and referred to the budget committee for further consideration and implementation.
- Tags/Keywords: Civil Service Rules, Merit Pay, Budget Committee, Employee Performance
- UID: 14f66e00-54bc-44bd-95f2-7290cec84862
messages.title: Regular City Council Minutes 11-16-2022

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Merit Increase Payment for Employees
- Summary: The ordinance outlines the eligibility criteria and payment amounts for merit increases for employees based on their performance evaluations. It also specifies the consequences for supervisors who fail to administer the performance evaluation system as per the rules.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 2 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, establishing the criteria for merit increases and consequences for supervisors who do not adhere to the performance evaluation rules.
- Tags/Keywords: Merit Increase, Performance Evaluation, Eligibility Criteria
- UID: 71e67dbb-1d1e-4a81-ac5f-8257688c695b

messages.page_content:
- Topic: Amendment to 2022 Operating Budget for New Orleans
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to amend the 2022 Operating Budget to reduce the appropriation to the Department of Police and increase the appropriation to the Department of Sanitation for additional expenses. The ordinance passed.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,967
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The appropriation to the Department of Police was reduced, and the Department of Sanitation received increased funding for additional expenses.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget, Police, Sanitation, Appropriation
- UID: c964dad9-4d09-4923-8c33-9ffefd348221

- Topic: Amendment to 2022 Operating Budget for New Orleans
- Summary: This ordinance also aimed to amend the 2022 Operating Budget to reduce the appropriation to the Department of Police and increase the appropriation to the Department of Sanitation for additional expenses. The ordinance passed.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,966
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (6 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 1 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Similar to the previous ordinance, the appropriation to the Department of Police was reduced, and the Department of Sanitation received increased funding for additional expenses.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget, Police, Sanitation, Appropriation
- UID: c964dad9-4d09-4923-8c33-9ffefd348221

- Topic: Amendment to Live Entertainment Permitting Regulations
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend and reordain existing regulations related to live entertainment permits. Councilmember Moreno introduced this ordinance, which includes provisions for both indoor and outdoor live entertainment events. The amendment also specifies different fee structures based on gross sales and distinguishes between nonprofit and for-profit entities.
- Ordinance Number: 33945
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 2 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance passed with a majority vote, indicating support for the proposed amendments to live entertainment permitting regulations.

It also extends the application of the ordinance to contracts entered into, renewed, or extended on or after January 1, 2023.

- Votes Summary:

- UID: ab42aea6-5153-4749-8847-4f0dd7a7ed46
